transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Hi, is this Zhi from Acme Corp.? This is Arjun, calling from MongoDB.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yes, this is Zhi. What’s this about?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: I’ll keep it quick—I saw Acme Corp. just wrapped up a data compliance review. I wanted to ask how you’re feeling about your current stack, especially with PostgreSQL.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Uh, it’s solid. We’re used to it. Why?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally fair. A lot of gaming studios I work with were there too. I’m reaching out because MongoDB Atlas is helping teams simplify compliance and scale, especially as player data gets more complex.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Honestly, we just invested a ton in our PG setup. Not sure we want the hassle of change. Data modeling alone is a lift.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: I hear you. Most of our gaming clients started small—usually migrating one use case at a time, like player profiles or inventory. Atlas is flexible, so you don’t have to go all-in on day one.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: That’s… interesting. But what about cost? Atlas looks pricey.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, pricing comes up a lot. But when customers run a TCO comparison, they often see savings as they reduce manual ops, avoid downtime, and scale elastically. Have you looked into that?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Not really. We’ve just heard horror stories about cloud bills spiraling.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Totally fair. Atlas has built-in usage controls, so you don’t get surprise bills. Plus, with dedicated cloud regions and managed backups, compliance is a lot less stressful.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Does Atlas cover GDPR by default? We have users in Europe and the US.

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: It does. We’re GDPR, SOC2, and ISO certified. You pick which region your data lives in, and there are built-in tools for auditing and access control.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Okay. But, uh, how do we avoid vendor lock-in if we move our game logic over?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Great question. Atlas is built on open source MongoDB, so you can self-host later if you choose. We also offer tooling to help migrate data back if need be.

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Alright… So, if we wanted to test this out, what’s the first step?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Easiest way is a 30-minute discovery call. We can map your current architecture, see where Atlas fits, and show you migration tools in action. Want to grab a slot this week?

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Yeah, I could do Thursday morning. Send me an invite and maybe some case studies?

transcription_sentences.speaker: sales_rep
transcription_sentences.text: Perfect. I’ll send the details and a couple of gaming stories you’ll like. Thanks for your time, Zhi!

transcription_sentences.speaker: prospect
transcription_sentences.text: Thanks, Arjun. Talk soon.
